results.title: Our church - portrait of a parish
results.creator_credit: Roberta King, Ronald Squire, Canadian Broadcasting Corporation and King Squire Films
results.brief_description: Film of parish life spoken by the Minister and parishioners young and old. Details births and marriages, town fair and parade and fundraising. As with all parishes worldwide, money is always a problem. The church was built in 1885 and renovated inside in 1970.

results.title: That certain age
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”
Discusses the times in a woman’s life when she is faced with change - change in family life when children grow up, change in feelings about herself, more self confident, but at the same time afraid that she is no longer attractive to men, and change in the biological sense of the menopause. It is a time when she’s either got everything she ever longed for, or has to face up to never having what she wants.

results.title: The Weapon of choice
results.creator_credit: Sue Crowther, Central Independent Television (UK), Nihon Hoso Kyokai and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “The Nuclear age”.
This program looks at the political, military and technological events that contributed to the Cold War between the Soviet Union and the United Statesof America. As tension rose between the two “Super-Powers’, the nuclear arms race began in earnest. When the Soviet Union exploded its first atomic bomb in 1949, President Truman stirred considerable controversy by deciding to pursue the development of the hydrogen bomb, six hundred times more powerful than the Hiroshima bomb. By 1953, the U.S. atomic arsenal had grown to over 1000 weapons.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sue Crowther, Central Independent Television (UK), Nihon Hoso Kyokai and WGBH (Boston)

results.title: People in chains
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Talks with people who have faced the dilemma of whether to sacrifice themselves looking after dependent relatives or hand the responsibility to the authorities. They have chosen the way of family loyalty, a strangely strong call of duty. The problem of dependents is one which has concerned society for a long time. In the end the responsibility lies with the individual - a member of the family. They are the “people in chains”.

results.title: Oscar's greatest moments, 1971-1991
results.creator_credit: Jeff Margolis and Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences
results.brief_description: An anthology of Hollywood’s biggest stars, funniest moments, famous speeches, glamourous and outrageous fashions, lavish production numbers, most popular songs, and legendary Honourary Award recipients - 21 years of show-stopping magic and excitement. Hosted by Karl Malden, this extraordinary documentary compiles the most memorable highlights from 21 years of televised Academy Awards.

results.title: A Proper little mother to them all
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
How does the oldest girl in a family look after her brothers and sisters when the mother has died or gone away? This film is about two such cases. Seventeen-year-old Carole who lost her mother through cancer a year ago, now looks after six young brothers and sisters on her own. Frances, who comes from a family of twelve however, has a father who works and provides for the family, and a Home Help who also does a lot of hard work for the twelve children, but Frances is the only mother the younger children will ever know.

results.title: I Call It Murder
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”. Broadcast U.K. November 1979
The results of drastic cuts in America’s health services are seen in the greatly reduced availability of free hospital treatment. Looks at the situation in a Chicago hospital serving the ghetto areas, which faces closure

results.title: At the brink
results.creator_credit: Peter Raymont, Central Independent Television (UK), Nihon Hoso Kyokai and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “The Nuclear age”.
In an exclusive interview, former Soviet Foreign Minister Andrei Gromyko speaks for the first time about his famous White House Meeting with President Kennedy at the height of the Cuban Missile Crisis, and refutes certain claims made at the time. “…Kennedy never raised the question of the presence of Soviet missiles in Cuba. I repeat, he never mentioned it.” The statesman recalled that the discussions were “full of sharp turns.” For the first time since the end of the Second World War, the Cuban Missile crisis brought the world to the brink of a Nuclear war.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Raymont, Central Independent Television (UK), Nihon Hoso Kyokai and WGBH (Boston)

results.title: David
results.creator_credit: Tom Kelly and Canadian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
David is a young actor with Down’s Syndrome, chosen to portray a mentally handicapped adolescent in a Canadian television play. Points out society’s unwillingness to accept potential from those with Down’s. David speaks about his condition to a school class and is shown skating, swimming, jogging and cycling, and interacting with family and friends. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: Pot
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Man Alive”.
Desmond Wilcox introduces and acts as interviewer/chairman with an audience of schoolboys, parents, doctors, & man from the council for civil Liberties, other scientists, a policeman, released pot smokers & others, to discuss the pros & cons of legalising cannabis in the U.K.
